titleproper.value: Preliminary Inventory to the Samuel Hirsch Papers <num>WAG.051</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Daniel Michelson and Gail Malmgreen, 2010

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-17T20:06:30</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Donated by Samuel Hirsch in 2000 and 2004. The accession number associated with these gifts is 1982.008.
Samuel Hirsch died in New York City in 2009.
<emph render="bold">NOTE: This collection is housed offsite and advance notice is required for use.</emph>

Persons (AARP), social security, workers compensation, United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) Local P-9's strike and boycott campaign against Hormel, Corporate Campaign, and the United Paperworkers International Union (UPIU) strike and boycott campaign against International Paper Company. </unittitle><unitdate normal="1985/1996" type="inclusive">1985-1996</unitdate><container id="aspace_c6d3d246014ba3796dd70ed341edf4fe" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740879]" type="Box">12</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref14" level="file"><did><unittitle>Miscellaneous subject files [31142051740887]" type="Box">13</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref15" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, photographs, and clippings related to social justice and labor issues in the Philippines, China, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Honduras, Guatemala, Mexico, South Africa, Haiti, and Northern Ireland.  There are additional materials related to free trade.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1981/1998" type="inclusive">1981-1998</unitdate><container id="aspace_839aed10e66fb0a95c11dba0cf1fbd6d" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740895]" type="Box">14</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref16" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union's national boycott of J.P. Stevens.  Arranged alphabetically by cities in New York, from Albany to Utica; then in the same way for cities outside New York; then for retailers.</unittitle><unitdate>undated</unitdate><container id="aspace_9ecb036ef15af8f0abf879b98c6e2a1f" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740903]" type="Box">15</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref17" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to anti-sweatshop campaigns, immigration, and health care.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1986/1998" type="inclusive">1986-1998</unitdate><container id="aspace_0c90691848de24026853f85ba40cf171" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740911]" type="Box">16</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref18" level="file"><did><unittitle>Miscellaneous subject files arranged alphabetically from Seniors to Youth Employment.  This is followed by correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to a jobs campaign advocating full employment.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1977/1980" type="inclusive">1977-1980</unitdate><container id="aspace_edcfc314292a08f4f6a4d3f9e88eb3f6" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740929]" type="Box">17</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref19" Yorkers for Accessible Health Coverage (NYFAHC).  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1979/1996" type="inclusive">1979-1996</unitdate><container id="aspace_95b40f5c12920da75a05590046f74d12" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740937]" type="Box">18</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref20" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to health care reform campaigns.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1974/1980" type="inclusive">1974-1980</unitdate><container id="aspace_5444eb166829dc8f986e46e7308d23ad" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740945]" New York State.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1980/1987" type="inclusive">1980-1987</unitdate><container id="aspace_3dba73e7a5ec1c643616fea353eed3a2" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740952]" workmen's compensation, and health care.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1980/2001" type="inclusive">1980-2001</unitdate><container id="aspace_99d994647fd6d0e9f0b5152f840e9469" label="Mixed Materials  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1975/1979" type="inclusive">1975-1979</unitdate><container id="aspace_3ccb896528e58f94c93a386ebf1c00a2" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740978]" type="Box">22</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref24" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the Joint Industry Board of the Painting and Decorating Industry, the Building and Construction Trades Council, apprenticeship and training programs in the construction industry, District No. 9 of the Brotherhood of Painters, Decorators, and Paperhangers of America, and urban renewal.  Includes item: "McGee, Willie: Flyer for Rally, NYC (with Josephine Baker, Paul Robeson, Vito Marcantonio, et al), Mar 19, 1951</unittitle><unitdate normal="1951/1973" type="inclusive">1951-1973</unitdate><container id="aspace_09592b8cb044a417ad4686c7e3230256" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740986]" type="Box">23</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref25" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to issues relevant to senior citizens, including, health care, social security, finance, and recreation.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1974/1983" type="inclusive">1974-1983</unitdate><container id="aspace_f1cbb917eb1135918cd2454e455e1729" label="Mixed Materials [31142051740994]" type="Box">24</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref26" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the American Federation of Musicians (especially local 802), union reform, union busting, the campaign for full employment, work sharing, and various labor struggles that Hirsch was part of.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1980/1992" type="inclusive">1980-1992</unitdate><container id="aspace_91973b333503bc4130b2c298714c9b21" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741000]" type="Box">25</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref27" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the National Labor/Religion Coalition, primarily in New York City, but also elsewhere in New York and New Jersey.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1986/2001" type="inclusive">1986-2001</unitdate><container id="aspace_27e43aa82c26798996d2f18cdfc07b2f" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741018]" type="Box">26</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref28" level="file"><did><unittitle>Health care subject files arranged alphabetically from Cornell-Health to NYSCNHS-Tristate-Minutes.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1974/1980" type="inclusive">1974-1980</unitdate><container id="aspace_485b380b823e0c6c34c6140f3b4d6647" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741026]" type="Box">27</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref29" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to labor struggles involving the following unions, among others: United Farmworkers of America (UFWA); the locals 111, 237, 282, 680, 819, 966, and the leadership of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (IBT); Local 100 of the Hotel Employees and Restaurant Employees Union (HERE); the United Needletrade and Industrial Employees Union (UNITE); Locals 32B-32J, 74, 144, 365, and 925 of the Service Employees International Union (SEIU); Local 919 of the United Paperworkers International Union (UPIU); Local 3 of the Newspaper Guild; the Chinese Staff and Workers Association; District 65 and Locals 2110 and 2325 of the United Auto Workers (UAW); Locals 306 and B571 of the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE); District 1199 of the Hospital & Health Care Employees Union; the Union for the Performing Arts; United University Professionals (UUP); United Rubber Workers Union; Local 404 of the United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers of America (UE); DC 1707 and Local 1000 of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME); the Farm Labor Organizing Committee (FLOC); the United Steelworkers of America; the Committee of Interns and Residents (CIR); Local 342 of the United Food and Commercial Workers International Union (UFCW); Locals 100, 234, and 1400 of the Transit Workers Union (TWU); and Local 16 of the National Association of Broadcast Employees and Technicians (NABET).  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1981/1998" type="inclusive">1981-1998</unitdate><container id="aspace_c18def9ee2e979ea089f046f30bacdb6" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741034]" type="Box">28</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref30" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the National Labor/Religion Coalition in New York State.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1988/2002" type="inclusive">1988-2002</unitdate><container id="aspace_29c3358c348a61790455583ba6a65f30" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741042]" type="Box">29</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref31" level="file"><did><unittitle>Miscellaneous subject files arranged alphabetically from INFACT (Infant Formula Action Coalition) to SALT.</unittitle><unitdate>undated</unitdate><container id="aspace_5a288798bd55b7a3d6ecfc08110e60a0" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741059]" type="Box">30</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref32" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to education, 9/11 memorial, the "Killer Coke" campaign, prison reform, police brutality and racial profiling, the Third World, New York State Labor Religion Coalition, labor unions (especially union reform), the Hale House charity, and leftist political parties.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1987/2002" type="inclusive">1987-2002</unitdate><container id="aspace_2095d16391419d2ce73a0686a75e2f15" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741067]" type="Box">31</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref33" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the campaign for universal health care.  There is also miscellaneous correspondence to and from the White House, U.S. Congress, the New York State legislature, and the New York City municipal government.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1975/1994" type="inclusive">1975-1994</unitdate><container id="aspace_dec8aca47c5472135593957abade80c1" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741075]" type="Box">32</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref34" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to child labor, rent control, prison reform, sweatshops, New York Labor Religion Coalition, health care, labor unions, senior citizens, Transport Workers Union (TWU) Local 100, City University of New York (CUNY), State University of New York (SUNY), election reform, the death penalty, and oil drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1987/2004" type="inclusive">1987-2004</unitdate><container id="aspace_fc5f38e2a4a0073b8d8b907443821d6d" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741083]" type="Box">33</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref35" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the Trade Union Health Education Project at the New York State School of Industrial & Labor Relations, Cornell University.  There is also material on the health care system in New York City.  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1969/1975" type="inclusive">1969-1975</unitdate><container id="aspace_234524c9e1766d7b9bd6fe93fd54c282" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741091]" type="Box">34</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref36" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports, publications, and clippings related to the campaign for national health insurance and the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union's national boycott of J.P. Stevens.  Also includes a film reel of a television program on the subject of national health insurance [REMOVED].  </unittitle><unitdate normal="1973/1979" type="inclusive">1973-1979</unitdate><container id="aspace_98128372ab8ea2813ab9483bb882dee0" label="Mixed Materials [31142051741109]" type="Box">35</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref37" level="file"><did><unittitle>Correspondence, reports,
